gurmukhi: pwie pro qumry sjnI AqhI mn BIqr mwn n k`eIXY ]sXwm bulwvq hY su jhw auT kY iqh Taur ibKY cil j`eIXY ]
transliteration: Paae Daro Toumre Sajniat-himan Bheetar Maan Na Kaeeyai|| Syaam Bulaavat Hai Su Jahaa Outh Kai Tih Thaur Bikhai Chal(i) Jaeeyai||
translation: “O friend! I fall at your feet, do not have any arrogance like this in your mind; you go to the place, where Krishna is calling you;

gurmukhi: nwcq hY ijm gÍwrnIAwN ncIXY iqm Aau iqh BwNq hI g`eIXY ]Aaur Anyikk bwq kro pr rwDy blwie ilau sauh n K`eIXY ]688]
transliteration: Naachai Hai Jim Gvaarneeaan Nacheeyaitim Au Tih Bhaant Higadeyai Aur Anekik Baat Daro Par Raadhe Balaae Lio Sauh Na Khaeeyai||688||
translation: “The way in which the gopis are dancing and singing, you may also dance and sing; O Radha ! you may talk about anything else except your oath regarding not going.”688.

gurmukhi: jYhau n hau sun rI sjnI quih sI hir sI hir gÍwrin kot pTwvY ]bMsI bjwvY qhw qu khw Aru Awp khw BXo mMgl gwvY ]
transliteration: Jaihau Na Hau Soun Risajnituh(i) Sihar(i) Gvaaran(i) Kot Pathaavai|| Bansibajaavai Tahaa Tu Kahaa Ar(u) Aap Kahaa Bhayo Mandal Gadvai||
translation: “O friend ! if Krishna sends millions of gopis like you, even then I shall not go; wherever he is playing on his flute and singing the songs of praise,

gurmukhi: mY n clo iqh Taur ibKY bHmw hmko khXo Awn sunwvY ]Aaur sKI kI khw gnqI nhI jwau rI jwau hir Awpn AwvY ]689]
transliteration: Mai Na Chalo Tih Thaur Bikhai Brahmaa Hamko Kahyo Aan Sounaavai|| Aur Sakhikikahaa Gadtinahijaao Rijaao Har(i) Aapan Aavai||689||
translation: “Even if Brahma comes and asks me, even then I shall not go there; I do not consider any friend of any account; you may all go and if Krishna wants, he can come himself.”689.
Speech of the messenger addressed to Radha:

gurmukhi: kwhy ko mwn krY sun gÍwrin sXwm khY auTkY kr soaU ]jwkY kIey hir hoie KuSI suinXI blkwj kro Ab joaU ]
transliteration: Kaahe Ko Maan Darai Soun Gvaaran(i) Syaam Kahai Outh-kai Kar Sooo|| Jaakai Keee Har(i) Hoe Khooshisouniyai Balkaaj Daro Ab Jooo||
translation: “O gopi! why are you absorbed in pride? Do whatever Krishna has said; do that work, which pleases Krishna,

gurmukhi: qau quih boil pTwvq hY jb pRIq lgI qumso qb koaU ]nwqr rws ibKY sun rI quihsI nih gÍwrin suMdr koaU ]690]
transliteration: Tau Tuhe Bol(i) Pathaaval Hai Jab Preet Lagitoumso Tab Kooo|| Naatar Raas Bikhai Soun Rituh(i)sinah(i) Gvaaran(i) Soundar Kooo||690||
translation: “He loves you, therefore he has sent me to call you, otherwise why there is none other so beautiful gopi in the whole amorous play?690.

gurmukhi: sMg qyry hI pRIq GnI hir kI sB jwnq hY kCu nwih neI ]ijh kI muK au`pm cMd pRBw ijh kI qn Bwmno rUp meI ]
transliteration: San Dere Hipreet Ghanidar(i) Kisabh Jaanat Hai Kachhu Naah(i) Naee|| Jih Kimoukh Ouppam Channd Prabhaa Jih Kitan Bhaamannd Roop Maee||
translation: “He is profound love with you; everyone knows it and this is not a new thing; he, whose face is glorious like the moon and whose body is beauty-incarnate,

gurmukhi: iqh sMg ko qXwg suno sjnI giH kI auT kY quih bwt leI ]biRjnwQ ky sMg sKI bhu qyrI rI qy sI guvwr BeI n BeI ]691]
transliteration: Tih San Ko Tyaag Souno Sajnigrih Kiouth Kai Tuhe Baat Laee|| Brijnaath Ke San Sakhibadoo Teririto Siguvaar Bhaina Bhaee||691||
translation: “Leaving his company, O friend! you have taken the path leading to your home; there are may young damsels in the company of Krishna, the lord of Braja; but there is none so uncivilised like you.”691.

gurmukhi: sun kY ieh gÍwrn kI bqIXw biRKBwn suqw mn kop BeI hY ]kwnH ibnw pTey rI qRIXw hmry aunky auT bIc peI hY ]
transliteration: Soun Kai Eh Gvaaran Kibateeyaa Brikhbhaan Soutaa Man Kop Bhaihai|| Kaahn Binaa Pathae Ritreeyaa Hamre Ounke Outh Beech Padhhai||
translation: Hearing these words of the gopi, Radha got infuriated and said, “Without being sent by Krishna, you have come in between me and Krishna;
